content.description: Begin with some moderate climbing and work your way into a strenuous undercling, at the third bolt, to prepare for the seam transfer. I personally find this crux move really difficult. Hard to trust the poor footholds. Then lieback and smear up past the hollow flake to a good rest. Navigate your way up a slightly tricky finish with one more really cool move to reach the anchors. A Piana classic that deserves more attention.
content.location: On the north face of The Shrub, follows the left seam just left of the steepest and streaked part of the wall.

content.description: Nice mixed climbing just two minutes from the road.  Start laying back the large flake (good nut placement behind) heading toward the two crux bolts. Unlock the tricky sequence and continue up the crack while placing mostly small gear.  At the top of the crack place the last possible piece(obvious nut) and do a couple thin traversing moves to the left until you can run it out on good crystals to the ledge. Two more bolts and your at the chains.
content.protection: A standard rack to 1" and nuts will do, however several smaller cams (c3's) opens up a lot more options. There is also a spot for a 4" cam before the traverse, but not necessary.
content.location: On the shrub, 20 ft downhill from Slang.

content.description: Beautiful and proud mixed line up the steepest part of the wall. Start the same as 'Slang' and use the first bolt if you'd like. Follow the rightward slanting crack up through the streaks to the two bolt crux. Bomber gear down low, bring a .5 camalot, .3 camalot, and one large nut. At the bolts make some powerful 5.12 moves right before the seam fades away to nothing. Bust out left and up to a really good pinch followed by more gear plugging to the top. Lots of fun!
content.protection: 2 bolts and finger size gear up to .75. Chain anchors.
content.location: North side of The Shrub. Starts on a crack that branches into two. This is the right slanted crack that goes up the steepest part of the wall.

content.description: This formation is just north of Pine Tree Rock and holds a few north facing routes, none of which summit. Any of the three summits can be reached by one of the chimneys/troughs. Fairly steep wall with some challenging classics on good rock.
